New Records: Giannis Antetokounmpo had his fourth triple-double of the season
Key Match Events: Milwaukee outscored Toronto 63-24 in bench points
Bucks handled the Raptors, building a 33-point lead, 113-80, after a Lopez 3-pointer in the fourth quarter
Portis connected twice from deep as the Bucks turned the game in their favor with a 20-2 run late in the opening quarter
Pre-Game Insights: Milwaukee has gone 16-8 in a stretch that began with a Nov. 12 home win over the Raptors
The Bucks have won twice as many games as they’ve lost since starting the season 2-8
Post-Match Reflections: Bucks handled the Raptors, building a 33-point lead, 113-80, after a Lopez 3-pointer in the fourth quarter
Miscellaneous Highlights: Khris Middleton (ankle) sat for Milwaukee after playing the past eight games
Toronto’s trio of Barnes, Quickley and Barrett played together for the first time this season, starting alongside Poeltl and Dick
Others: Raptors shot 9 for 35 from long range, going 4 for 26 through the first three quarters
